title: 'Disgusting': British influencer slammed for putting underwear between breads in supermarket
content: A video of a woman taking off her underwear and then keeping it amid breads at a supermarket has drawn flak and disgust of social media. According to reports, the woman in the viral challenge video was Chole Lopez, an English influencer, who claimed to have done this bizarre act on camera as part of a challenge.
summary: A video of a woman taking off her underwear and then keeping it amid breads at a supermarket has drawn flak and disgust of social media. According to reports, the woman in the viral challenge video was Chole Lopez, an English influencer, who claimed to have done this bizarre act on camera as part of a challenge.

title: Harris campaign editing news headlines in her favour within Google search ads: Report
content: Kamala Harris' campaign was editing news headlines in Google ads to create a favorable image without news websites' consent. Google stated the ads did not breach policies, although a technical glitch made some ads appear lack disclosures. Brands like CNN, USA Today, and NPR were unaware their links were used this way.
summary: Kamala Harris' campaign was editing news headlines in Google ads to create a favorable image without news websites' consent. Google stated the ads did not breach policies, although a technical glitch made some ads appear lack disclosures. Brands like CNN, USA Today, and NPR were unaware their links were used this way.

title: 'Frightening': New Zealand charity unknowingly distributes meth-laced candy
content: A New Zealand charity inadvertently handed out candies laced with lethal amounts of methamphetamine, leaving three individuals ill. Authorities are investigating the incident, highlighting the complex methods of drug importation. The New Zealand Drug Foundation revealed that each candy contained 3 grams of methamphetamine, making them extremely dangerous.
summary: A New Zealand charity inadvertently handed out candies laced with lethal amounts of methamphetamine, leaving three individuals ill. Authorities are investigating the incident, highlighting the complex methods of drug importation. The New Zealand Drug Foundation revealed that each candy contained 3 grams of methamphetamine, making them extremely dangerous.

title: Watch: Barron Trump's friend is asked why Gen Z would vote for Donald. His 20-second reply is...
content: Barron Trump's influencer friend Bo Loudon who is working for Trump campaign said 'rightful president' Donald Trump did not run America like other presidents, but like a businessman. He made it thrive like his other businesses and Gen Z would vote him for economic security, Bo Loudon said on Fox News.
summary: Barron Trump's influencer friend Bo Loudon who is working for Trump campaign said 'rightful president' Donald Trump did not run America like other presidents, but like a businessman. He made it thrive like his other businesses and Gen Z would vote him for economic security, Bo Loudon said on Fox News.

title: Nikki Haley says Trump must stop whining about Kamala Harris: 'Talking about her race, dumbness...'
content: Former GOP presidential hopeful Nikki Haley said Donald Trump and the Republicans should stop whining about Kamala Harris succeeding Joe Biden's contest as they anticipated it pretty well. In an interview with the Fox News, Nikki launched an attack on Kamala Harris and said there's no need for an interview of her; as she can be taken at her word when she says illegal immigrants should be able to vote and be given driver's licenses.
summary: Former GOP presidential hopeful Nikki Haley said Donald Trump and the Republicans should stop whining about Kamala Harris succeeding Joe Biden's contest as they anticipated it pretty well. In an interview with the Fox News, Nikki launched an attack on Kamala Harris and said there's no need for an interview of her; as she can be taken at her word when she says illegal immigrants should be able to vote and be given driver's licenses.

title: Judge rejects Donald Trumpâ€™s recusal plea for third time in hush money case
Donald Trump explains his slurring, lisping in interview with Musk: 'Strange'
content: Former president Donald Trump took to Truth Social after he was heard lisping and slurring in the X interview with Elon Musk and acknowledged that he sounded strange. But it was not owing to any medical reason, the GOP presidential candidate said adding that it was because of the "complexity of modern day equipment, and cellphone technology".
summary: Former president Donald Trump took to Truth Social after he was heard lisping and slurring in the X interview with Elon Musk and acknowledged that he sounded strange. But it was not owing to any medical reason, the GOP presidential candidate said adding that it was because of the "complexity of modern day equipment, and cellphone technology".

title: Hong Kong activist gets three days in jail in prison complaint form case
content: A Hong Kong court sentenced pro-democracy activist Owen Chow to three days in jail for giving an unauthorised document to his solicitor, Phyllis Woo, who was fined HK$1,800. Chow, already serving a five-year term, faces potential life imprisonment on separate charges. He intends to appeal the new conviction and sentence.
summary: A Hong Kong court sentenced pro-democracy activist Owen Chow to three days in jail for giving an unauthorised document to his solicitor, Phyllis Woo, who was fined HK$1,800. Chow, already serving a five-year term, faces potential life imprisonment on separate charges. He intends to appeal the new conviction and sentence.

title: German military base sealed off due to suspected sabotage, security source says
content: A German military base near Cologne airport was sealed off due to suspected sabotage. Authorities advised 4,300 soldiers and 1,200 civilian employees not to drink tap water over contamination fears. The base houses the fleet used by Chancellor Olaf Scholz and his ministers. Investigations are ongoing with no immediate suspects identified.
summary: A German military base near Cologne airport was sealed off due to suspected sabotage. Authorities advised 4,300 soldiers and 1,200 civilian employees not to drink tap water over contamination fears. The base houses the fleet used by Chancellor Olaf Scholz and his ministers. Investigations are ongoing with no immediate suspects identified.

title: Turkey, Iraq to hold new round of security talks in Ankara, source says
content: Senior Turkish and Iraqi officials met in Ankara to discuss cooperation on security issues, as relations improved following Turkish President Erdogan's visit to Baghdad. Iraq labelled the PKK a banned organization. Talks aim to institutionalize agreements and evaluate further initiatives, with Turkey's cross-border operations set to continue until terrorism is eradicated.
summary: Senior Turkish and Iraqi officials met in Ankara to discuss cooperation on security issues, as relations improved following Turkish President Erdogan's visit to Baghdad. Iraq labelled the PKK a banned organization. Talks aim to institutionalize agreements and evaluate further initiatives, with Turkey's cross-border operations set to continue until terrorism is eradicated.

title: More than 1,000 arrested following UK riots, police say
content: British authorities arrested over 1,000 people following days of rioting sparked by misinformation about the killings of three girls in Southport. The unrest, involving violence, arson, and racist attacks, spread across England and Northern Ireland. Swift judicial actions led to many being jailed. The National Police Chiefs' Council reported 1,024 arrests and 575 charges across the UK.
summary: British authorities arrested over 1,000 people following days of rioting sparked by misinformation about the killings of three girls in Southport. The unrest, involving violence, arson, and racist attacks, spread across England and Northern Ireland. Swift judicial actions led to many being jailed. The National Police Chiefs' Council reported 1,024 arrests and 575 charges across the UK.

title: Two South Korean missionaries kidnapped in northern Kenya
content: Gunmen kidnapped two South Korean missionaries in northern Kenya near the Ethiopian border. The abduction occurred in the village of Odda, and their phone was last traced to the border. National police and local officials are involved in the investigation. In a separate incident, eight Kenyans were shot dead west of Moyale, and their bodies were burned.
summary: Gunmen kidnapped two South Korean missionaries in northern Kenya near the Ethiopian border. The abduction occurred in the village of Odda, and their phone was last traced to the border. National police and local officials are involved in the investigation. In a separate incident, eight Kenyans were shot dead west of Moyale, and their bodies were burned.

title: Why New Zealand citizens are leaving the country in record numbers?
content: Government statistics revealed a record number of New Zealanders left the country due to rising unemployment and weak economic growth. In the year ending June 2024, 131,200 departures were recorded, with 75% moving to Australia. The central bank reduced interest rates to 5.25% as inflation neared its target range, indicating economic challenges for New Zealand.
summary: Government statistics revealed a record number of New Zealanders left the country due to rising unemployment and weak economic growth. In the year ending June 2024, 131,200 departures were recorded, with 75% moving to Australia. The central bank reduced interest rates to 5.25% as inflation neared its target range, indicating economic challenges for New Zealand.

title: Why did Japan's PM Kishida resign: A visionary step or compulsion?
content: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida announced he will not seek re-election in the September LDP leadership vote. Kishida's popularity had dipped due to corruption scandals, affecting public trust. Speculation is rising about potential successors, including Toshimitsu Motegi and Taro Kono, who will be elected as the new prime minister.
summary: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida announced he will not seek re-election in the September LDP leadership vote. Kishida's popularity had dipped due to corruption scandals, affecting public trust. Speculation is rising about potential successors, including Toshimitsu Motegi and Taro Kono, who will be elected as the new prime minister.

title: UK woman killed husband, hid body for 18 years before dying uncaught
content: In November 2015, the skeletal remains of John Sabine were found wrapped in plastic in Beddau, Wales. His wife, Leigh Ann Sabine, who died in October 2015, was believed to have killed him 18 years earlier. She concealed his body and continued to collect his pension until her death. The case was revealed posthumously.
summary: In November 2015, the skeletal remains of John Sabine were found wrapped in plastic in Beddau, Wales. His wife, Leigh Ann Sabine, who died in October 2015, was believed to have killed him 18 years earlier. She concealed his body and continued to collect his pension until her death. The case was revealed posthumously.

title: High doses of meth found in candy distributed by New Zealand charity
content: A New Zealand charity distributed food parcels containing candies filled with lethal amounts of methamphetamine. Approximately three grams of methamphetamine were found in the candies. The distributed parcels affected eight families, though no hospitalizations were reported. The police have launched a criminal investigation, and the charity is contacting up to 400 people to retrieve the contaminated parcels.
summary: A New Zealand charity distributed food parcels containing candies filled with lethal amounts of methamphetamine. Approximately three grams of methamphetamine were found in the candies. The distributed parcels affected eight families, though no hospitalizations were reported. The police have launched a criminal investigation, and the charity is contacting up to 400 people to retrieve the contaminated parcels.

title: Ilhan Omar wins primary race in Minnesota
content: Ilhan Omar secured her primary win in Minnesota's 5th District against Don Samuels with a 56.2%-42.9% lead. Omar, part of the progressive 'Squad,' emphasized themes of housing and healthcare rights in her victory speech. Fundraising played a crucial role, with Omar raising $6.2 million compared to Samuels' $1.4 million. Omar will now face Republican Dalia Al-Aqidi.
summary: Ilhan Omar secured her primary win in Minnesota's 5th District against Don Samuels with a 56.2%-42.9% lead. Omar, part of the progressive 'Squad,' emphasized themes of housing and healthcare rights in her victory speech. Fundraising played a crucial role, with Omar raising $6.2 million compared to Samuels' $1.4 million. Omar will now face Republican Dalia Al-Aqidi.

title: Who is Eric Hovde? Millionaire businessman who won Wisconsin's Senate GOP primary
content: Millionaire businessman Eric Hovde won the Wisconsin GOP Senate primary, defeating two minor candidates. He will now challenge Democratic Senator Tammy Baldwin in the upcoming election. Hovde, endorsed by former President Trump, aims to reduce costs, secure the border, and address healthcare issues. Baldwin portrays Hovde as a wealthy outsider out of touch with voters.
summary: Millionaire businessman Eric Hovde won the Wisconsin GOP Senate primary, defeating two minor candidates. He will now challenge Democratic Senator Tammy Baldwin in the upcoming election. Hovde, endorsed by former President Trump, aims to reduce costs, secure the border, and address healthcare issues. Baldwin portrays Hovde as a wealthy outsider out of touch with voters.

title: 'Biggest political corruption scandal': Hunter Biden sought US assistance in Burisma deal, says report
content: Hunter Biden reportedly sought help from the US Ambassador to Italy in 2016 to secure a deal for Burisma, a Ukrainian gas company where he was a board member, while his father was Vice President. The White House confirmed President Biden was unaware of this outreach. No meetings or projects materialized from Hunter Biden's requests.
summary: Hunter Biden reportedly sought help from the US Ambassador to Italy in 2016 to secure a deal for Burisma, a Ukrainian gas company where he was a board member, while his father was Vice President. The White House confirmed President Biden was unaware of this outreach. No meetings or projects materialized from Hunter Biden's requests.

title: Watch: Nasa astronaut shares timelapse video showing Moon setting behind Earth amid auroras
content: Nasa astronaut Matthew Dominick recently shared a captivating timelapse video from the International Space Station showing the moon setting amidst vibrant auroras. The video, captured with a new lens, highlighted the impact of recent solar eruptions. These geomagnetic storms have intensified, producing remarkable aurora displays. Dominick's footage has attracted significant attention, showcasing stunning visuals observed from 420 kilometers above Earth.
summary: Nasa astronaut Matthew Dominick recently shared a captivating timelapse video from the International Space Station showing the moon setting amidst vibrant auroras. The video, captured with a new lens, highlighted the impact of recent solar eruptions. These geomagnetic storms have intensified, producing remarkable aurora displays. Dominick's footage has attracted significant attention, showcasing stunning visuals observed from 420 kilometers above Earth.
